lru-type.name: FLOOG
lru-type.fullname: Fine Tune Synthesizer First Local Oscillator
lru-type.description: Of these functions, fine tuning will be implemented using the FTS in the second LO, fringe rotation and sideband separation will be implemented using the FTS in both the first and second LOs and phase switching and side band suppression will be implemented using the FTS of the first LO.

assembly-type.name: FLOOG
assembly-type.dev-name: Fine Tune Synthesizer First Local Oscillator
assembly-type.description: Of these functions, fine tuning will be implemented using the FTS in the second LO, fringe rotation and sideband separation will be implemented using the FTS in both the first and second LOs and phase switching and side band suppression will be implemented using the FTS of the first LO.

baci-property.description: This is a read back of the SET_FREQ command. It is used to verify that the FTS has received the previous SET_FREQ command. It will return zero if the SET_FREQ command has never been called. The default output frequency upon power up of the FTS is DC or zero hertz.

monitor-point.description: This is a read back of the SET_FREQ command. It is used to verify that the FTS has received the previous SET_FREQ command. It will return zero if the SET_FREQ command has never been called. The default output frequency upon power up of the FTS is DC or zero hertz.

baci-property.description: This is a read back of the SET_PHASE_VALS command. It is used to verify that the FTS has received the previous SET_PHASE_VALS command. It will return all zeros if the SET_PHASE_VALS command has never been called.

monitor-point.description: This is a read back of the SET_PHASE_VALS command. It is used to verify that the FTS has received the previous SET_PHASE_VALS command. It will return all zeros if the SET_PHASE_VALS command has never been called.

baci-property.description: This is a read back of the SET_PHASE_SEQ1 command. It is used to verify that the FTS has received the previous SET_PHASE_SEQ1 command. It will return all zeros if the SET_PHASE_SEQ1 command has never been called.

monitor-point.description: This is a read back of the SET_PHASE_SEQ1 command. It is used to verify that the FTS has received the previous SET_PHASE_SEQ1 command. It will return all zeros if the SET_PHASE_SEQ1 command has never been called.

baci-property.description: This is a read back of the SET_PHASE_SEQ2 command. It is used to verify that the FTS has received the previous SET_PHASE_SEQ2 command. It will return all zeros if the SET_PHASE_SEQ2 command has never been called.

monitor-point.description: This is a read back of the SET_PHASE_SEQ2 command. It is used to verify that the FTS has received the previous SET_PHASE_SEQ2 command. It will return all zeros if the SET_PHASE_SEQ2 command has never been called.

baci-property.description: This monitor point provides the counts number of clock cycles between the previous TE and the preceding TE for both inverted and non-inverted clocks. It can be used to verify that the number of clock cycles between timing events is exactly 6 million. This monitor point should be used for debugging purposes. For operational purposes use the GET_FTS_STATUS command.

monitor-point.description: This monitor point provides the counts number of clock cycles between the previous TE and the preceding TE for both inverted and non-inverted clocks. It can be used to verify that the number of clock cycles between timing events is exactly 6 million. This monitor point should be used for debugging purposes. For operational purposes use the GET_FTS_STATUS command.

baci-property.description: Status of the output RF power level of the FTS. One bit will latch if a transient problem in the FTS output RF power level is detected. Status of clock cycles between timing events. One of two bits is latched high if the number of clock cycles between TE is not exactly 6000000. The number of clock cycles between TE is counted for both inverted and non-inverted clocks. All latched bits except bit 5 can be unlatched using the RESET_FTS_STATUS command. Bit 5 can be changed with the SET_CLOCK_INVERSION command.

monitor-point.description: Status of the output RF power level of the FTS. One bit will latch if a transient problem in the FTS output RF power level is detected. Status of clock cycles between timing events. One of two bits is latched high if the number of clock cycles between TE is not exactly 6000000. The number of clock cycles between TE is counted for both inverted and non-inverted clocks. All latched bits except bit 5 can be unlatched using the RESET_FTS_STATUS command. Bit 5 can be changed with the SET_CLOCK_INVERSION command.

baci-property.description: This is the read back of SET_PHASE_OFFSET. It is the amount by which the phase switching is delayed. The delay the first phase switching value is a minimum of 8 ms and a maximum of 15.9996 ms with 8 ns of resolution.

monitor-point.description: This is the read back of SET_PHASE_OFFSET. It is the amount by which the phase switching is delayed. The delay the first phase switching value is a minimum of 8 ms and a maximum of 15.9996 ms with 8 ns of resolution.

baci-property.description: 8 bytes: Byte 0: 0x55 (Product Tree Digit 1: Product Tree Digit 2) Byte 1: 0x40 (Product Tree Digit 4: Product Tree Digit 6) Byte 2: Firmware Revision 0.0 to 15.15 Byte 3: Firmware Date (Day) Byte 4: Firmware Date (Month) Byte 5: Firmware Date (Year, 2000 0x00) Byte 6, 7: These will always be 0xFF

monitor-point.description: 8 bytes: Byte 0: 0x55 (Product Tree Digit 1: Product Tree Digit 2) Byte 1: 0x40 (Product Tree Digit 4: Product Tree Digit 6) Byte 2: Firmware Revision 0.0 to 15.15 Byte 3: Firmware Date (Day) Byte 4: Firmware Date (Month) Byte 5: Firmware Date (Year, 2000 0x00) Byte 6, 7: These will always be 0xFF

baci-property.description: Generic Monitor Point. Revision level of the embedded code. This is the software embedded in the AMBSI or the programmable device that is handling the AMB communications.
